meanings.definition: The quality of being more merciful or tolerant than expected.
meanings.sent1: Her lenience towards her students made them feel safe and supported.
meanings.sent2: The judge's lenience towards the first-time offender was unexpected but appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The lenience of the teacher allowed the students to make mistakes and learn from them.
meanings.sent4: His lenience was like a gentle breeze, calming the storm of conflict.
meanings.sent5: The lenience of the mother was like a warm hug on a cold day, comforting and reassuring.

meanings.definition: The act of showing mercy or forgiveness.
meanings.sent1: The lenience of the king spared the criminal from a harsh punishment.
meanings.sent2: In times of war, acts of lenience can lead to peace and reconciliation.
meanings.sent3: The lenience shown by the coach towards the losing team lifted their spirits.
meanings.sent4: Her lenience was a beacon of hope in a sea of despair.
meanings.sent5: The lenience of the judge was like a ray of sunshine breaking through the clouds of guilt.

meanings.sent1: The lenience of the principal in allowing extra time for the assignment was appreciated by the students.
meanings.sent2: His lenience in granting extensions showed understanding and compassion.
meanings.sent3: The lenience of the referee in overlooking a minor foul kept the game fair and enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her lenience in accepting late submissions gave the students a second chance to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The lenience of the boss in forgiving mistakes created a positive and supportive work environment.
